title: Jodhpur
short_description: Stay in one of the world's largest private residences under the gaze of Mehrangarh.
long_description:
Jodhpur, the Blue City, stands at the edge of the Thar Desert, dominated by the colossal Mehrangarh Fort. Founded in 1459 by Rao Jodha, it is a city of warriors, palaces, and vibrant indigo-hued houses. The city is famous for its equestrian heritage, polo, and Marwari cuisine.

The crown jewel of Jodhpur's hospitality is Umaid Bhawan Palace, one of the world's largest private residences and a symbol of Art Deco grandeur. Staying here is an experience in royal living unmatched anywhere else. Beyond the main palace, Jodhpur offers boutique heritage stays in restored havelis like RAAS, which offer stunning views of the illuminated fort at night. A trip to Jodhpur is a journey into the heart of Rajputana valor and luxury.

properties.title: Umaid Bhawan Palace
properties.short_description: A magnificent piece of Rajasthan's heritage and a symbol of new Jodhpur, home of the erstwhile Jodhpur royal family.

properties.title: RAAS Jodhpur
properties.short_description: Jodhpur's first boutique hotel, comprising four restored buildings in red sandstone at the foot of Mehrangarh Fort.

properties.title: Ajit Bhawan
properties.short_description: Built for the younger brother of the Maharaja, this palace offers a unique blend of royal heritage and sylvan charm.

properties.title: Bal Samand Lake Palace
properties.short_description: A red sandstone palace built in 1159 AD, set amidst lime and pomegranate orchards by the lake.

properties.title: Ranbanka Palace
properties.short_description: A part of India's royal history, this palace hotel offers an immersive experience into the Jodhpur colonial lifestyle.

how_to_reach: Jodhpur Airport connects to major cities. The railway station is well linked.
